column4: why was the decision made to leave OUT gcc as part of ubuntu install ? LOL
I mean talk about embarrasing
I write to forum about not being able to get this script working only to find gcc isn't even installeddddddddddd
rant over
minimalistic is good sometimes but gez louise..I think leaving OUT gcc is a big mistake
no
gcc is rarely needed by most desktop users
yeah I do understand..but gez even redhat comes with it for petes sake LOL
a noob to linux would be truly confused anyway
I dont mind gcc not being here in light of 'ease of use' and all..maybe I should be a bit angrier at the 'script' designer that he didn't 'check' for availability OF gcc..
I spent all night wondering WHY ( well half an hour at least) this wasn't compiling when I know it did before LOL..sigh..oh well least I know why not LOL
if you were a desktop user and new to linux, would  you use gcc?
def. not LOL

I understand why its left out I just wish maybe a warning of some type maybe..cause I sat here wondering what the heck is wrong....installing it is SO dain easy too so...mabye a little warning somewhere as reminder for such uncommon times like programmings that dont check for gcc being installed in their scripts and for people like me that ( late at night) sadly didn't 'catch' thats what was wrong....either way it
file a bug
well before doing it I wanted to make sure I wasn't the ONLY one seeing it...and I posted on forum and got no reply so I thought I might be...
are you seeing this type of behavior at all ?
you are NOT the only one
well I feel somewhat better anyway <G>
ask ##linux or #gnome
good news
